intro: Chomelia banksiana, commonly known as the Banksian chomelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest understories. The leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
